t:intro.p: The clustering coefficient, introduced by Watts and Strogatz in the context of binary undirected graphs, is frequently used for analyzing the structure of a network. The LocalClusteringCoefficient function extends the clustering coefficient to directed and weighted graphs. The LocalClusteringCoefficient function is based on the paper "Clustering in complex directed networks"by Georgio Fagiolo.
For general information about the clustering coefficient, see D. J. Watts and S. H. Strogatz. Collective dynamics of "small-world" networks. Nature, 393:440–442, 1998
The definition of the local clustering coefficient depends on the graph type:
The local clustering coefficient was originally defined on an unweighted, undirected graph—also called a bi-directed network (BUN). A simple BUN has no self-loops and no multiple edges.
Let G = (V, E) be a simple BUN with a set of nodes (vertices) V and a set of edges E.

The degree d
i of node i is the number of nodes in V that are adjacent to i. A complete subgraph of three nodes of G is called a triangle. This is the formula for the number of triangles of node i:

where a
ij = 1 if there is an edge from i to j; otherwise a
ij = 0.
A triple Ƴ at a node i is a path of length two for which i is the center node. This is the formula for the maximum number of triples of node i:
The maximum number of triples occurs when every neighbor of node i is connected to every other neighbor of node i.

This is the formula for the clustering coefficient for a node i with d
i ≥ 2:

c
i = δ i / τ i
For an unweighted, directed network (BDN), given a vertex i, the BDN triangle types can be categorized to four patterns.

td.div: There is a cyclical relation among i and any two of its neighbors: i→j→h→i, or the reverse.
One of i’s neighbors, j, both holds an outward edge to a third neighbor, h, and uses i to reach h in two steps.

t:intro.p: For each pattern, this is the formula for the clustering coefficient (CC):

c
i * = δ i * / τ i *
where {*}={cycle, middleman, in, out}.

For a weighted, directed network (WDN), CC is extended as:
where {*}={cycle, middleman, in, out}.

Assuming w
ij is the weight on the edge i→j, for node i, these are the formulas for the weighted triangle for each pattern:

For a weighted, undirected network (WUN), assuming that w
ij is the weight on the edge i→j, for node i, the formula for the clustering coefficient is:

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM LocalClusteringCoefficient ( ON vertices_table AS Vertices PARTITION BY vertex_key_column [,...] ON edges_table AS Edges PARTITION BY source_vertex_key_column [,...] USING TargetKey ({ 'target_vertex_column' | target_vertex_column_range }[,...]) [ Directed ({'true'|'t'|'yes'|'y'|'1'|'false'|'f'|'no'|'n'|'0'}) ] [ EdgeWeight ('edge_weight') ] [ DegreeRange ({ '[min:max]' | '[min:]' | '[:max]' }) ] [ Accumulate ({ 'accumulate_column' | accumulate_column_range }[,...]) ] ) AS alias;

t:intro.p: Note: In the DegreeRange syntax element, the brackets inside the single quotation marks are required. They do not indicate that their contents are optional.

div.dd: Specify the key of the target vertex of an edge. The key consists of one or more Edges table column names.
[Optional] Specify whether the graph is directed.
[Optional] Specify the name of the Edges table column that contains the edge weights. Each edge weight is a positive value in the range (0-1].
Default behavior: The function treats the input graph as unweighted.

[Optional] Specify the edge degree range—at least min and at most max ([min:max]), at least min ([min:]), or at most max ([:max]). The min and max must be positive integers. The function outputs only nodes with degrees in the specified range.
Default behavior: The function outputs all nodes.
[Optional] Specify the names of the Vertices table columns to copy to the output table.

t:intro.p: Each row represents a vertex of the graph. If the table has duplicate vertices, the function uses the first one and ignores its duplicates. The table can have additional columns, but the function ignores them.

td.div: [Column appears once for each specified vertex_key_column.] All or part of unique vertex key. Cannot be NULL.
[Column appears once for each specified accumulate_column.] Column to copy to output table.

t:intro.p: Each row represents an edge of the graph. The table can have additional columns, but the function ignores them.
The data-checking rules for the Edges table are, given nodes A and B:

ul.li: No graph can have multiple A→B edges.
An undirected graph cannot have edges A→B and B→A.

td.div: Column appears once for each specified source_vertex_key_column.] All or part of key that identifies source vertex of edge. Must be a vertex_key_column in Vertices table. Cannot be NULL.
Column appears once for each specified target_vertex_key_column.] All or part of key that identifies target vertex of edge. Must be a vertex_key_column in Vertices table. Cannot be NULL.
[Required only for weighted graph.] Edge weight. Function uses only positive edge weights. Sum of edge weights that function uses must be 1.

t:intro.p: The output table schema depends on the graph type. For descriptions of the graph types, see LocalClusteringCoefficient Background.
The output table schemas for BDN and WDN graphs use cycle, middleman, in, and out triangles, which are explained in Unweighted, Directed Network (BDN).

td.div: [Column appears once for each specified accumulate_column.] Column copied from Vertices table.
Number of neighbors of node (nodes directly connected to this node).
[Column appears once for each specified accumulate_column.] Column copied from Vertices table.
Number of cycle triangles for node.
Number of middleman triangles for node.
Number of in triangles for node.
Number of out triangles for node.
Total number of triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for cycle triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for middleman triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for in triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for out triangles for node.
[Column appears once for each specified accumulate_column.] Column copied from Vertices table.
Number of cycle triangles for node.
Number of middleman triangles for node.
Number of in triangles for node.
Number of out triangles for node.
Total number of triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for cycle triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for middleman triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for in triangles for node.
Clustering coefficient for out triangles for node.
Weighted clustering coefficient for cycle triangles for node.
Weighted clustering coefficient for middleman triangles for node.
Weighted clustering coefficient for in triangles for node.
Weighted clustering coefficient for out triangles for node.
Overall weighted clustering coefficient for node.
[Column appears once for each specified accumulate_column.] Column copied from Vertices table.
Number of neighbors (nodes directly connected to this node).

t:intro.p: This example treats the input graph as a weighted, undirected network (WUN).
In the following figure, nodes represent countries, edges connect countries that trade with each other, and numbers on edges represent trade propensity.
The graph in the figure is represented by the Vertices and Edges tables country and trade, respectively.

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM LocalClusteringCoefficient ( ON trade as Edges PARTITION BY fromid ON country as Vertices PARTITION BY countryid USING TargetKey ('toid') EdgeWeight ('tradeweight') Directed ('f') Accumulate ('countryid', 'name') ) AS dt ORDER BY countryid;

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.
This example treats the input graph as a weighted, undirected network and outputs only nodes with degree range 3 or greater.
Input tables are from LocalClusteringCoefficient Example: WUN:

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM LocalClusteringCoefficient ( ON trade AS Edges PARTITION BY fromid ON country AS Vertices PARTITION BY countryid USING TargetKey ('toid') Directed ('f') EdgeWeight ('tradeweight') DegreeRange ('[3:]') Accumulate ('countryid', 'name') ) AS dt ORDER BY countryid;

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.
This example treats the input graph as a weighted, directed network (WDN).
Input tables are from LocalClusteringCoefficient Example: WUN:

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM LocalClusteringCoefficient ( ON trade AS Edges PARTITION BY fromid ON country AS Vertices PARTITION BY countryid USING TargetKey ('toid') EdgeWeight ('tradeweight') Directed ('t') Accumulate ('countryid') ) AS dt ORDER BY countryid;

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.
